III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions.
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
Description (ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing a youth
on any part of their body
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 3/5/24, Staff 1 pushed Youth A ‘s head into the wall, so Youth
A threatened Staff 1. Youth A was charged and placed in
detention as a result.
Investigation This complaint was received on 03/11/2024 and assigned for joint
investigation with MDHHS Specialist.
Interviews:
I attempted to contact the Complainant via telephone on
03/11/2024. A voicemail message was left requesting a call back. As
of the date of this report, a return call has not been received.
I spoke with Youth A’s Foster Care Worker on 03/11/2024. Foster
Care Worker reported the agency has placed a 30-removal notice
due to Youth A’s aggressive behavior toward staff and other
residents.
I interviewed Director at the agency on 03/12/2024, in collaboration
with MDHHS Specialist 1. Director reported on 03/5/2024 Youth A
was triggered when Staff 1 took a vape away and Youth A went after
Staff 1 with a box cutter knife. The incident occurred outside on the
lawn between the cottages and the administration building. There are
no walls, and he is not aware of any other incidents involving Staff 1
pushing Youth A' s head into the wall. He denied witnessing Staff 1
push or physically manage Youth A. Youth A was found to have
buried two box cutter knives in the dirt outside of the cottages. The
police were contacted, and Youth A was taken to the Juvenile
Detention Facility (JDF) for three days. Youth A’s behavior has
continued to escalate and therefore the agency submitted a 30-day
removal letter. Youth A requires constant redirection and engages in
behaviors that put staff and other youths in danger. Director reported
the knives were hidden in the dirt outside of the cottages. He said
Youth A AWOLs and when he returns to campus, he hides things in
the wooden area of the campus.
2

I interviewed Youth A at the agency on 03/12/2024, in collaboration
with MDHHS Specialist 1. Youth A is 11 years old and has been at
the agency for 3 months. Youth A was asked about the incident that
occurred involving Staff 1 and Youth A denied anything happened.
Youth A was again asked, but he refused to answer any questions
regarding the incident. Youth A denied Staff 1 hit his head or did
anything to hurt him. Youth A reported feeling safe and did not
express any concerns regarding staff. Youth A said he was restrained
yesterday for assaulting staff. Youth A said he was restrained by
Supervisor 1. Youth A reported he does have bruises on his arms
and was seen by the nurse. Youth A was asked if the bruises were
from being restrained and he said he does not know. Youth A was
observed picking at his skin on his arm. Youth A was observed to
have bruises on both arms.
I interviewed Staff 1 at the agency on 03/12/2024, in collaboration
with MDHHS Specialist 1. Staff 1 is a direct care worker and has
been working at the agency for 3 years. Staff 1 recalled the incident
on 03/05/2024, Staff 1 said Youth A was outside and he was
following Youth A around trying to maintain line of sight. He observed
Youth A to have a vape pen, so he took the vape pen from Youth A.
When Staff 1 turned around Youth A came at him with a box cutter
knife, Staff 2 was driving by and beeped the horn alerting Staff 1 that
Youth A was about to strike him in the back with the knife. Staff 1
turned around and swatted the knife out of Youth A’s hand. Staff 1
said he felt like Youth A was going to slice him. Staff 1 denied hitting
or physically managing Youth A. Youth A ran off after the incident and
was found behind the cottages with another knife. The knives had dirt
on them, so it is believed that Youth A had buried the knives behind
the cottage. The police were contacted, and Youth A was taken to
JDC.
I interviewed Staff 2 at the agency on 03/12/2024, in collaboration
with MDHHS Specialist 1. Staff 2 reported on 03/05/2024, he was
coming back to campus from picking up medication. He witnessed
Youth A coming up to Staff 1 with a box cutter knife. Staff 1’s back
was turned to Youth A, so he beeped the horn alerting Staff 1 to
Youth A coming at Staff 1 with the knife. Staff 2 was approximately
10 feet away from Youth A and Staff 1. Staff 2 denied witnessing Staff
1 push or hit Youth A.
I interviewed Staff 3 at the agency on 03/12/2024, in collaboration
with MDHHS Specialist 1. Staff 3 is a direct care worker and has
been working at the agency for over a year. Staff 3 was working with
Staff 1 on 03/05/2024. Staff 3 reported he and Staff 1 were in the
3

cottage and Youth A left the cottage without permission, so Staff 1
followed Youth A. Staff 3 did not witness the incident outside with
Staff 1 and Youth A. Staff 3 denied witnessing Staff 1 hit or push
Youth A.
A follow up visit was completed on 04/02/2024 with MDHHS
Specialist 2. The investigation was reassigned to MDHHS Specialist
2.
I interviewed Director at the agency on 04/02/2024, in collaboration
with MDHHS Specialist 2. Director reported Youth A continues to
struggle, but his behaviors has improved the last two weeks. Youth A
has a court hearing on 04/08/2024 and he will have a tether due to
the assault charges and AWOLing. Director reported Youth A has 66
incident reports from 02/02/24 to 03/24/24. The incident reports are
for physical and verbal aggression, fighting, property destruction,
stealing, and AWOLing. A 30-day removal letter was submitted to
Youth A’s Foster Care Worker on 03/08/2024.
I interviewed Supervisor 1 at the agency on 04/02/2024, in
collaboration with MDHHS Specialist 2. Supervisor 1 recalled on
03/11/2024 Youth A was struggling because earlier in the day he had
AWOLed to the dollar store. Supervisor 1 followed and witnessed
Youth A steal an aux cord. Supervisor 1 made Youth A return the
items to the dollar store. Supervisor 1 said when he and Youth A
returned to campus, Youth A was aggressive, hitting and throwing
rocks at him. He said he did restrain Youth A on 03/11/2024 while
they were on the playground of the campus. He denied grabbing or
hurting Youth A. He demonstrated a standing restraint holding Youth
A’s wrists. Supervisor 1 denied that Youth A sustained any injuries
from the restraint. Supervisor 1 said earlier that day, Youth A was
hitting and scratching himself while outside, so he is not sure if that’s
how Youth A may have received the bruises.
I interviewed Youth A at the agency on 04/03/2024, in collaboration
with MDHHS Specialist 2. Youth A denied being hurt or injured by
Staff 1 or Supervisor 1. Youth A admitted that sometimes he fights
with other youths. Youth A was asked several times about being
restrained and he kept repeating he does not remember being
restrained. Youth A reported feeling safe at the agency and all his
needs are being met. Youth A was observed picking and pinching his
arm during the interview.
I interviewed Youth B at the agency on 04/03/2024, in collaboration
with MDHHS Specialist 2. Youth B reported he is in the same cottage
with Youth A. Youth B said Youth A runs his mouth often and always
4

starts fights. Youth B said there is always a staff person supervising
and staff stop the fights. Youth B denied witnessing any staff member
hit or hurt Youth A. Youth B has not witnessed Youth A being
restrained. Youth B did not express any concerns regarding staff.
I interviewed Youth C at the agency on 04/03/2024, in collaboration
with MDHHS Specialist 2. Youth C is 12 years old and has been at
the agency for 2 months. Youth C is placed in the same cottage with
Youth A. Youth C reported he gets enough to eat, participates in
weekly therapy, and all his needs are being met. Youth C said Youth
A is rude and is always “starting fights”. Youth C reported there is
always staff supervising and staff do break up fights. Youth C denied
witnessing Youth A being pushed or hurt by staff.
A predisposition conference was held with MDHHS Specialist 2 on
04/09/2024. There is no finding by MDHHS Specialist 2.
Documents reviewed:
• Incident reported dated 03/05/2024 completed by Staff 1.
Youth A was outside with a vape pen. Staff 1 took the vape
pen from Youth A, so Youth A became triggered and came
after Staff 1 with a box cutter knife. The police were
contacted, and Youth A was taken into custody.
• Youth A’s 30-day removal letter dated 03/08/2024. A 30-
day removal letter was submitted due to Youth A
consistently engaged in behaviors that have and continue
to lead to a serious and imminent threat to the health and
safety of Youth A, Staff, and other Youths. Youth A
requires 1:1 Supervision and Youth A continues to engage
in behaviors that put himself, his peers, and the staff that is
working with him in danger.
• Incident report dated 03/11/2024 at 12pm, written by
Supervisor 1. Youth A AWOLed to the Dollar Store.
Supervisor 1 followed Youth A and observed Youth A
stealing an aux cord. Supervisor 1 made Youth A return
the cord to the clerk. Youth A returned to campus with
Supervisor 1. Youth A was struggling and refused to follow
directive. Youth A started to throw sticks and became
aggressive with Supervisor 1. Youth A was placed in a CPI
child control standing position.
• Incident reported dated 03/11/2024 at 5pm, written by
Supervisor 1. While on the playground Youth A became
escalated and aggressive with Supervisor 1. Youth A was
placed in a CPI child control standing position.
• Methodist Intervention Standards and Prohibitions Policy
outlines discipline standards for youth. The facility prohibits
5

any form of corporal punishment and/or inappropriate
hands-on intervention such as but not limited to; pinching,
spanking, slapping, hitting, twisting arms, paddling, pulling
hair, grabbing, pushing, and threatening gestures.
• Methodist Restraint Policy. Crisis Prevention Institute-
Nonviolent Crisis Intervention The staff approach is to
apply nonviolent physical crisis intervention, which is a
safe, non-harmful control and restraint position to safely
control a young person until he can regain control of his
behavior. This is only used as a last resort, after verbal
interventions have been attempted, and the young person
presents a danger to self or others.
• Youth A’s body chart exam completed by Nurse, dated
03/12/2024. Youth A had a bruise on his right upper arm,
and a bruise on his lower left arm. The form did not
indicate where the bruises came from.
• Personnel file for Staff 1 - no disciplinary action.
Analysis Based on interviews conducted and documentations reviewed,
there is insufficient evidence to support the allegations staff
pushed Youth A’s head into the wall. Staff and Youth interviewed
denied staff hit youth.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
6

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
